intro: Helianthemon tuberarium, commonly known as the tuberous helianthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are typically succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Helianthemon tuberarium is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for rock gardens or dry landscapes.
